biography.content:
Hassane Darhmaoui got his PhD in Physics from the University of Alberta, Edmonton, Canada in 1997. He joined Al Akhawayn University in Ifrane (AUI), Morocco just after his graduation in January 1997. He is currently an associate professor in the School of Science and Engineering and the coordinator of the Center for Learning Technologies. His R&D research at AUI mainly focuses on renewable energies applications: energy efficiency in rural houses, solar air conditioning hybrid system, Concentric PV, and wind-hydrogen system. His research in education centers on ICT integration in science education and astronomy popularization. Dr. Darhmaoui is a co-author of more than 40 research papers and has more than 60 presentations in various conferences and scientific meetings. He was the principal investigator/coordinator of a number of funded projects. He is a member of a number of scientific societies and groups.
Dr. Darhmaoui is a Fulbright alumnus; he spent his Fulbright research at the National Institute of Standards & Technology, Boulder, Colorado, US during summer 2002.  He was also a visiting research scholar at the University of a South Carolina, US in 2000.
Dr. Darhmaoui got his PhD in Physics from the University of Alberta, Edmonton, Canada in 1997. He joined Al Akhawayn University in Ifrane (AUI), Morocco just after his graduation in January 1997. He is currently an associate professor in the School of Science and Engineering and was appointed as the coordinator of the Center for Learning Technologies at AUI since 2009. His research on educational technologies mainly centers on ICT integration in science education and astronomy popularization.   Dr. Darhmaoui has other R&D research interests related to renewable energies applications, manly in concentric solar power and photovoltaics.
Dr. Darhmaoui is a co-author of more than 40 research papers and has more than 60 presentations in various conferences and scientific meetings. He was the principal investigator/coordinator of a number of funded projects. He is a member of a number of scientific societies and groups.
Dr. Darhmaoui is a Fulbright alumnus; he spent his Fulbright research at the National Institute of Standards & Technology, Boulder, Colorado, US during summer 2002.  He was also a visiting research scholar at the University of a South Carolina, US in 2000.
